snippet: The United States military has begun looking into two instances in which coalition airstrikes against the Sunni militancy known as the Islamic State may have inadvertently hit civilians.
abstract: Pentagon Press Sec Rear Adm John Kirby says United States is looking into reports of civilian casualties in Iraq and Syria that possibly happened due to American-led airstrikes against Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: The United States military has begun looking into two instances in which coalition airstrikes against the Sunni militancy known as the Islamic State may have inadvertently hit civilians.

headline.main: Reports of Civilian Deaths Prompt Inquiry Into Strikes Against ISIS
headline.print_headline: Reports of Civilian Deaths Prompt Inquiry Into Strikes
